subject: Ethics
title: Synthetic Biology Ethics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Synthetic Biology Ethics.

hook.text: In 2010, Craig Venter built a living cell from scratchâ€”synthetic DNA booted up like software.

buildup.text: Synthetic biology designs and builds new biological systems that don't exist in nature.

discovery.text: It could produce clean fuels, new medicines, and biodegradable materials. The potential is enormous.

twist.text: The same tools that cure disease could create bioweapons. DNA sequences are available online.

climax.text: Dual-use risk means every breakthrough in synthetic biology is also a potential catastrophe.

punchline.text: Creating life from scratch means owning the consequences too.

quiz.question: What is the 'dual-use' problem in synthetic biology?
options: Synthetic organisms can only survive in labs, not in nature
The same technology that creates cures could also create bioweapons
Synthetic biology is too expensive for widespread use
